zg-button.description: Sets the action of the button

enumValues.batcheditcancel: Cancels batch edit changes and mode
enumValues.batcheditsave: Saves batch edit changes and closes mode
enumValues.cancel: Cancels the record to be created or edited
enumValues.closerowdetails: Hides details section of the row
enumValues.closerowgroup: Hides the descendent rows of the row
enumValues.copycell: Adds the formatted content of the selected cell to clipboard
enumValues.createrecordend: Creates a new record and places it at the end of the data
enumValues.createrecordstart: Creates a new record and places it at the start of the data
enumValues.editcell: Enables edit mode on a single cell
enumValues.editrecord: Enables edit mode on a record
enumValues.editrow: Enables edit mode on a row
enumValues.filter: Opens menu on a column to perform filter in grid column
enumValues.freezecolumnleft: Freezes selected column and place into left (frozen) panel
enumValues.freezecolumnright: Freezes selected column and place into right (frozen) panel
enumValues.unfreezecolumn: Unfreezes selected column and place into middle (unfrozen) panel
enumValues.freezerowtop: Freezes selected row and place on top (frozen) panel
enumValues.freezerowbottom: Freezes selected row and place on bottom (frozen) panel
enumValues.unfreezerow: Unfreezes selected row and place on middle (unfrozen) panel
enumValues.getselection: Add the raw values of selected cells to the clipboard
enumValues.insertrecord: Creates a new row at specified position
enumValues.menu: Opens menu to hide or show columns
enumValues.openrowdetails: Displaying details section of the row
enumValues.openrowgroup: Displays the descdendent rows of the row
enumValues.pastecell: Pastes content into the selected cell
enumValues.undoremoverecord: Undos the last removed record action
enumValues.search: Displays input field to perform a search in grid
enumValues.submitrecord: Submits the record to be created or edited
enumValues.about: Opens about details about the ZingGrid library

zg-button.description:
Set to a template or a function to return true or false to set the disabled state
The function's callback receives rowData and zg-cell object if in a cell
Sets the tooltip in the case of custom buttons.  Can override the default tooltip on builtin buttons
Presence of attribute determines if the button is disabled or not

By default, action buttons have no border and custom buttons do.  
You can force a border by setting the `[force-border]` attribute and you can force no border by setting `[force-border="disabled"]`
A custom function to call on button click
Sets the icon for the button

zg-caption.description: The alignment of content in the caption
Indicates where to position the caption

enumValues.top: place on top of the grid
enumValues.bottom: place at the bottom of the grid
enumValues.both: place on both the top and bottom of the grid

zg-card.description: Points to an external template element to be used as the template for the card's editor.

The return value of the method is set as the innerHTML of `<zg-card>`.  If nothing is returned,
it will not change the currently rendered card. The method takes the parameters `data`, `domCard`, and `rowObject`.
Points to an external template element to be used as the template for the card's render.

zg-checkbox.description: Presence of attribute determines if the checkbox is checked

zg-column.description: Aligns the contents of the cell
If the index is an array of objects, use array-index to indicate which index of the array object to include
If the index is an array, you can use array-slice to indicate which array indexes to include.
Presence of attribute forces a border on the button.  Setting to `disabled` removes the default border.

The type of `word-break` style for body cells. When not set, `cell-break` style is `normal` by default.
If the width of a column is set, `cell-break` is `word` by default.

enumValues.ellipsis: instead of line break, overflow is replaced with ellipsis
enumValues.normal: line break occurrs between words, if possible

zg-column.description:
The class to be set directly on `<zg-cell>` within the column. `cell-class` applied to
`<zg-column>` will overwrite the `cell-class` applied to `<zing-grid>`.
Sets the execution method of custom 'icon' type tooltips to either activate on hover or click of the icon

enumValues.hover: hover over cell to display tooltip

zg-column.description: Sets the hover delay in milliseconds before displaying the tooltip
Specifies the icon to use for the cell tooltip trigger icon when using the info column type
Sets the tooltip-position for the cell

enumValues.top: Positions the tooltip on top of cell
enumValues.left: Positions the tooltip to the left of cell
enumValues.right: Positions the tooltip to the right of cell
enumValues.bottom: Positions the tooltip at the bottom of cell

zg-column.description: Gets the name of the user's custom render function, on window, to use the function's return value as the tooltip content
Points to an external template element to be used as the template for the tooltip display
Sets the tooltip text for the cell of the column.  Can pass this value to renderer or template if using
Sets the style to use for the tooltips.  Uses the `default` style by default.  Can set to `system` to match the tooltips used on icons throughout `<zing-grid>`.

enumValues.system: Features a dark background and white text.

zg-column.description:
When an additional HTML element is added to the renderer, as in the case of image and url,
`content-style` will be put into a style attribute directly on the element.

Sets the width of the content inside of the cell. Used on cells of column type
`element`, `iframe`, `image`, or `url`.
The data to display in each cell where the data value is null or undefined

Renderer for the details page of a column.
To use a custom renderer, the attribute should be set to the name of the function.
The renderer function takes in the following arguments, `value of index` (for each index), `domCell`, and `cellObject`.
The returned value of the renderer function is set as the innerHTML of the details dialog.
Points to an external template element to be used as the template for the column's details
Disables the drag state of a specific column when `column-drag` enabled on `<zing-grid>`

Overrides the default editor for the column.  Can be set to a different built-in editor (based on type of column),
custom editor, or `false` to turn off editor.
If set to a custom editor, the attribute value should be set to the name of the object.
See "Features" page on "Editing: Custom Editor Grid" for more details on custom editor.
Points to an external template element to be used as the template for the column's editor
Overrides the grid level `filter` attribute.  Presence of attribute enables the menu on `filter` column.  Can be set to `inline`, `menu`, `both`, or `disabled`

enumValues.menu: Enables filter menu that allows for complex filtering options
enumValues.both: Enables both the inline and menu filtering

zg-column.description: Comma separated list of buttons to display on the filter menu

enumValues.reset: Add button to reset filter condition(s)
enumValues.close: Add button to close filter menu
enumValues.apply: Add button to apply filter condition(s)

zg-column.description:
The list of conditions to present as options in the filter menu condition select.  Use "break" to display the horizontal separator.  
Use "default" to use the built in default.  Can also be any custom string representing a function name.

enumValues.none: Does not apply any filter conditions
enumValues.equals: Filters for an exact match of the filter term
enumValues.notEquals: Filters out exact match of the filter term
enumValues.beginsWith: Filters for values beginning with filter term
enumValues.endsWith: Filters for values ending with filter term
enumValues.contains: Filters for values containing filter term
enumValues.notContains: Filters for values not containing filter term
enumValues.between: Filters for number values between two filter terms
enumValues.notBetween: Filters for number values not between two filter terms
enumValues.greaterThan: Filters for number values greater than filter term
enumValues.greaterEqualThan: Filters for number values greater than or equal to filter term
enumValues.lessThan: Filters for number values less than filter term
enumValues.lessEqualThan: Filters for number values less than or equal to filter term
enumValues.before: Filters for date values before filter term
enumValues.after: Filters for date values after filter term
enumValues.betweenDate: Filters for date values between filter terms
enumValues.break: Not a filter condition. Adds a horizontal separator in filter condition select menu.
enumValues.default: Filter for values containing filter term

zg-column.description: Number of conditions to display in the filter menu on menu open
Max number of conditions to display in the filter menu
The condition to initially display on filter menu open.  Can also be any custom string representing a function name.

enumValues.none: Does not apply any filter conditions
enumValues.equals: Filters for an exact match of the filter term
enumValues.notEquals: Filters out exact match of the filter term
enumValues.beginsWith: Filters for values beginning with filter term
enumValues.endsWith: Filters for values ending with filter term
enumValues.contains: Filters for values containing filter term
enumValues.notContains: Filters for values not containing filter term
enumValues.between: Filters for number values between two filter terms
enumValues.notBetween: Filters for number values not between two filter terms
enumValues.greaterThan: Filters for number values greater than filter term
enumValues.greaterEqualThan: Filters for number values greater than or equal to filter term
enumValues.lessThan: Filters for number values less than filter term
enumValues.lessEqualThan: Filters for number values less than or equal to filter term
enumValues.before: Filters for date values before filter term
enumValues.after: Filters for date values after filter term
enumValues.betweenDate: Filters for date values between filter terms
enumValues.break: Not a filter condition. Adds a horizontal separator in filter condition select menu.
enumValues.default: Filter for values containing filter term

zg-column.description: Sets the data field index to filter on if index itself has multiple fields.  The value set in index is the default.
Sets the key for server side filtering.  By default the filterKey is set to the filterIndex value.
zg-column.defaultValue: the value of the column's filterIndex

zg-column.description: The areas to display in the filter menu.  Can be conditions, selectbox, or both

enumValues.conditions: Filter by selecting a condition and entering a term
enumValues.selctbox: Filter using checkboxes generated from the columnâ€™s distinct values
enumValues.both: Filter by both conditions and selectboxes

zg-column.description:
Determines if the filter comparison should be against the raw values or the rendered
This only applies to conditionals in the filter menu.
For iframe column type, it is restricted to raw values.
For aggregate column type, it is restricted to rendered values.
Determines if the selectbox in the filter menu should display the values as raw or rendered values.
Action that fires the filter event from the filter menu.

enumValues.button: Fires a filter event on filter button click
enumValues.change: Fires a filter event when filter conditions or selections are updated

zg-column.description:
Overrides the default filterer for the column. Can be set to a different built-in filterer or to a custom filterer
If set to a custom filterer, the attribute value should either be set to the object that contains: `init`, `afterInit`, `value`, `setValue`, and `triggerEvent` OR it can be set to a function that will be used for the `value` method which will fire on filter change. Note that the custom filterer only applies to the inline filter and not the conditions or select box options (filter menu).

The aggregate function, tokenized string, or function to evaluate for the foot cell of the column.
If using a function, the function takes the parameters `columnData` and `columnFieldIndex`.
Moves the column to the frozen panel specified

Includes the column to the row-group column. To enable features on grouped row columns, set attributes on `ZGColumn[type="row-group"]`.
All other attributes on the `[group]` column(s) are ignored.
Sets a head cell on the column in the grouped row.

The aggregate function to evaluate for the head cell of the column.
If using a function, the function takes the parameters `columnData` and `columnFieldIndex`.
The header name for the column.   If it is not set, the default is to format the `index` value.

Setting to `disabled` will turn off formatting on the header of the column.  By default, headers will
convert camel, dash, or kebab case to a properly spaced and capitalized string.  Or
set to a function name to customize formatting of header text.  The custom function takes in two parameters,
`index` and `headerText`, and returns the formatted header text.
Sets the header icon position in the header cells

enumValues.left: Places icon left of header text
enumValues.right: Places icon right of header text

zg-column.description: Sets the execution method of custom 'icon' type tooltips to either activate on hover or click of the icon

enumValues.hover: hover over header to display tooltip

zg-column.description: Sets the hover delay in milliseconds before displaying the header tooltip
Specifies the icon to use for the header tooltip trigger icon
Sets the tooltip icon position for the tooltip icon in the header cells

enumValues.left: Positions the icon to the left of the header
enumValues.right: Positions the icon to the right of the header

zg-column.description: Sets the tooltip-position for the header cell

enumValues.top: Positions the tooltip at the top of the header cell
enumValues.left: Positions the tooltip to the left of the header cell
enumValues.right: Positions the tooltip to the right of the header cell
enumValues.bottom: Positions the tooltip at the bottom of the header cell

zg-column.description: Gets the name of the user's custom render function, on window, to use the function's return value as the tooltip content
Points to an external template element to be used as the template for the tooltip display
Sets the tooltip text for the header cell of the column.  Can pass this value to renderer or template if using
Sets what part of the header triggers the tooltip.  If set to 'icon', an info icon is added to the header.

enumValues.text: Header tooltip is triggered by header text
enumValues.icon: Header tooltip is triggered by header tooltip icon

zg-column.description: Sets the style to use for the tooltips.  Uses the `default` style by default.  Can set to `system` to match the tooltips used on icons throughout `<zing-grid>`.

enumValues.system: Features a dark background and white text.

zg-column.description: Adds an icon next to the header text.
Presence of attribute hides the column

A single index or multiple indices (separated by comma), to associate information in the data source
 to a column in the grid.  Nested data keys are referenced by the member character `.` (Ex. data.key).
Localization code used with column type `currency` and `number`
The text to display in the control menu for the column.  If it is not set, it is set to the header text.
Sets the minimum width of the column in pixels

Overrides the default renderer for the column.  Can be set to a different built-in or custom renderer.
To use a custom renderer, the attribute should be set to the name of the function.
The renderer function takes in the following arguments, `value of index` (for each index), `domCell`, and `cellObject`.
The returned value of the renderer function is set as the innerHTML of the cell.
Points to an external template element to be used as the template for the column's renderer
Indicates that the column is required to have a value on edit
Turns on column resizing for single column.  Set to `disabled` to turn off resizing on a single column.
Sets the maximum width the column can be set to when resizing
Sets the minimum width the column can be set to when resizing
Modifies the default column resizable persistence.  Set to `disabled` to turn off persistence on a single column.
Turns off the search on a column if `search` is present on `<zing-grid>`

enumValues.disabled: Removes column from being part of search

zg-column.description: If multiple indices are set, this is the string that separates them in the display.  By default, it is a comma.
Turns off the sort on a column if `sort` is present on `<zing-grid>`
Presence of attribute sorts the column data in ascending order
Presence of attribute sorts the column data in descending order
Overrides default behavior for setting special sort for international data

enumValues.disabled: Disables default sort behavior for international data

zg-column.description:
Overrides the default sorter for the column.  It is also possible to override the column sorting by
passing in method name of sort function instead or setting to `disabled` to disable sorting.  Sorter function
takes in two values (a, b) and returns 1, -1, or 0 indicating if `a > b`, `a < b`, or `a = b`.
Can also be set to a path in the dataset to perform the sort on.  This is useful for sorting object indices.
The type of the data stored in the column.  The column renderer/editor will behave based on the column type.

enumValues.color: Renders a color preview that uses a color picker editor
enumValues.currency: Formats the number as a currency
enumValues.custom: Slots in column content that references data through template delimiters
enumValues.date: Formats the value as a date
enumValues.duplicate: Renders a button to duplicate the row
enumValues.editor: Displays a button to edit the row
enumValues.element: Renders an element that wraps the cell content
enumValues.email: Renders a clickable email link using the mailto: protocol
enumValues.number: Renders a number value that uses a number editor
enumValues.password: Renders the value as a masked password
enumValues.radio: Renders a text value that uses a radio editor
enumValues.range: Renders a number value that uses a numeric stepper editor
enumValues.remover: Displays a button to remove the row
enumValues.select: Renders a text value that uses a select dropdown as an editor
enumValues.selector: Displays checkbox for selecting the row
enumValues.url: Renders a clickable link that navigates to the URL value

zg-column.description: Presence of attribute ignores the column in aggregation calculations
The token or aggregate value to use to display if the column is an aggregation column
Presence of attribute sets the button to be in a disabled state. Can also set to "true" or "false".

When the column type is set to `button`, use `typeButtonHander` to hook up a function call to the button click.
Callback receives rowData, zg-cell DOM, and zg-cell object as arguments.
When the column type is set to `button`, use `typeButtonIcon` to add an icon next to the rendered button in the cell
When the column type is set to `button`, use `typeButtonLabel` to add a label to the rendered button in the cell
When the column type is set to `button`, use `typeButtonTooltip` to add a tooltip to the rendered button in the cell
When the column type is set to `button`, use `typeButtonURL` to add a shortcut handler on button click.  The click will automatically open the url in a new window.
When the column type is set to `checkbox`, use `typeCheckboxLabel` to add a label next to the rendered checkbox in the cell
Sets the color mode to configure the color picker. Choose between HSL, RGBA, and the default Hex.
Disable the default color swatch UI preview with a false value.
By default, spaces are added into the color when in RGB or HSL mode.  Turn the spaces off by setting to `disabled`

enumValues.disabled: Disables formatting color value by not adding spaces

zg-column.description:
The currency to be used in currency formatting.
Currency is set using using the 3 letter currency code specified by ISO 4217 specification (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217)
The tokenized formatting for a date column
Indicates if date should be displayed in FromNow format
Sets the attribute of the custom-element in the column when `<zg-column>` has `type` set to `element`

Sets the tag to wrap content when `<zg-column>` has `type` set to `element`.
If `type-element-attribute-name` isn't set, it will put the rendered data into the body of the element.
If `type-element-attribute-name` is set, it will set the attribute to the indexed value.
Set to function to convert shortcodes to emojis
Presence of the attribute disables the display of the row count on the row-group column

Indicates the word to use if the count is plural or singular.  Comma separated with singular first.
The word can be referenced by the token `group.plural` and is used in a renderer or template.
Sets a "square" ratio instead of the default "16:9"
The alternative text used with the `image` type column
The alternative shape to mask the image
If the column type is `image`, use the `type-image-src` attribute to set the src for the image.  The src will be the index value by default.
Indicates the exact numbers to display after the decimal
Set to "disabled" to turn off default number formatting

enumValues.disabled: Disables number formatting and does not add thousands separator

zg-column.description: Indicates the maximum numbers to display after the decimal
Indicates the minimum numbers to display after the decimal

When the column type is set to `radio`, use `typeRadioOptions` to add rendered radio options in the cell.
Can also set as array of name/value pairs where the name is displayed for the given value
Maximum value for the input box. Used with the `range` type column in edit mode.
Minimum value for the input box.  Used with `range` type column in edit mode.
Specifies the step between each legal value for the input box.  Used with `range` type column in edit mode.

Renderer for the row details component
To use a custom renderer, the attribute should be set to the name of the function.
The renderer function takes in the following arguments, `recordData`, `domRowDetails`, and `rowObject`
The returned value of the renderer function is set as the innerHTML of the zg-row-details component.
Points to an external template element to be used as the template for the row's details
The default value of a new record.  The select box in the create record will default to the specified value.

In edit mode, presence of attribute allows column type `select` to have multiple selections, instead of the default
of a single selection

To set the options for the select box for a `select` column when `editor` is enabled on `<zing-grid>`.
Can also set as array of name/value pairs where the name is displayed for the given value
Keeps the selected rows selected even on page change.  This means that rows can be selected and not on the current page.
When the column type is set to `toggle`, use `typeToggleOptions` to set the list of options for the display.
When the column type is set, the render and value will be the same.  This prevents the default creating of true/false for toggles.

If the column type is `url`, use this attribute to reference any `<zg-icon>` within the library
to replace the link text with this icon.

enumValues.link: Displays a "link" icon, implying navigating within same site
enumValues.outsidearrow: Displays an "outsidearrow" icon, implying redirecting to third

zg-column.description: If the column type is `url`, use the `type-url-src` attribute to set the src for the link.  The link will be the index value by default.

If the column type is `url`, use this attribute to set the target window of the click.  
Uses the same values as HTML `<a>` `[target]` attribute.  `_blank` by default
If the column type is `url`, use the `type-url-text` attribute to set the text displayed for the link.
Sets the validation error message for the column.  Overrides any other settings.
Sets the validation required message for the column.  Overrides any other settings.
Sets the width of the column. Can also be any custom string representing a percentage value (10%) or pixel value (150px).

enumValues.fit: Sets width of column to fit both the header and content
enumValues.fitheader: Sets width of column to fit header
enumValues.fitcontent: Sets width of column to fit content
enumValues.stretch: Sets width of column to stretch to remainder of the grid's width

zg-column:type.description:
Will render a column containing the aggregate value of each row.
Specify aggregate calculation with `[typeAggregateValue]` to return the aggregate of columns and rows.
When `[footCell]` or `[headCell]` is set without `[typeAggregateValue]` to return the aggregate of all numeric value grid cells.
Will render a true|false string value and the editor will use an input field with `type="checkbox"`
Will render a button and the editor is disabled
Will render a checkbox that can be toggled
Will render a preview of the color and display a color picker when editing the cell
Will render the currency symbol in front of the number and the editor will use an input field with `type="number"`

Will slot in column content and allow referencing data via `[[index.key]]` or `[[record.key]]`, and the editor will
use an input field with `type="text"`
Will render the date as a string value and the editor will use an input field with `type="date"` expecting (dd/mm/yyyy) dates
A render only field to display an icon to duplicate the record on click.
A render only field to display an icon to edit the record on click
Will wrap cell content with value specified in `[type-element-tag-name]` with the attribute specified in `[type-element-attribute-name]`
Will render a string value and the editor will use an input field with `type="email"`
Will render a string value that contains emojis in codepoint format

A render only field to set icon to convert the cell data into a built-in grid `<zg-icon name="">` element. 
By default, the value must match the name of a native grid icon or the name of a custom icon. Editing will use an input field with `type="text"`.
Will render an `` and the editor will use an input field with `type="text"`.
A render only field to display an `<iframe>`. Editing will use an input field with `type="text"`.
Will render a number as a thousand's separated string value and the editor will use an input field with `type="number"`.
Will render a hidden string value and the editor will use an input field with `type="password"`.
Will render a number as a percentage string value and the editor will use an input field with `type="number"`.
Will render selected option in cell and the editor will use an radio options specified in `typeRadioOptions`.
Will render a number as a thousand's separated string value and the editor will use an input field with `type="number"` with optional `min`, `max` and `step` fields defined on the input.
A render only field to display an icon to remove the record on click.
A render only field to display expandable details section.
A render only field to display the row grouping.
A render only field to display the current row index of this row.
Will render a string value and the editor will use an input field with `type="select"`.
A render only field to display an checkbox to selector and remove the record on click.
Will render a string value and the editor will use an input field with `type="tel"`.
(Default Type) Sets the column type to text.
Renders a value that is toggleable when clicked
Will render the field to to display an `<a>` tag. The editor will use an input field with `type="text"`.

zg-data.description:
Adapter is a shortcut to set known options for specific third party datasets.  Currently supports `graphql` and  `firebase`.
Developers could register their own custom adapters.  For more information on custom adapters, visit Guides > ZingGrid Object > registerAdapter().

Data for the grid presented as an array or object.  If set as an attribute value, the
data needs to be in JSON format.

In the case of non-key based objects, the idKey can be set to indicate the id to send back to the datasource on CRUD commands.
For example, if the READ URL was https://zinggrid-named.firebaseio.com/ then the UPDATE would be https://zinggrid-named.firebaseio.com/VALUE_OF_IDKEY.

Used to set `<zg-param>`, the configuration data for `<zg-data>`.  This should never be used directly as an attribute and
is meant for object instantiation and for setting in JavaScript.
Specifies the absolute or relative URL to fetch data from to populate the grid

zg-dialog.description:
Callback method to call on custom dialog when the dialog's "cancel"
button is clicked

Callback method to call on custom dialog when the dialog's "confirm"
button is clicked
The presence of the specification-standard `open` attribute designates whether the dialog is shown or hidden

zg-input.description: The built-in behavior and display of the input.  Gets and sets the associated grid property.
The type of the input if not using a built-in action

zg-menu.description:
Presence of attribute replaces the default context menu with a custom menu.
If `replace` is not set, the custom menu will be appended to the end of the default menu.

zg-pager.description: Sets the number of records or rows to display per page
Sets the number of cards to display per page when in card mode
Sets the number of rows to display per page when in row mode
Determines which type of pagination to use, input or buttons
Determines max number of page buttons to display.  Default is 5.
Indicates where to position the pager

enumValues.top: place pager on top of the grid
enumValues.bottom: place pager at the bottom of the grid

zg-pager.description: Sets the options for page size in `zg-option-list`

zg-param.description: The value for given data key.  If the value is an object, format as JSON encoded version of string.

zg-param:name.description:
Adapter is a shortcut to set known options for specific third party datasets.  Currently supports `graphql` and  `firebase`.
Developers could register their own custom adapters.  For more information on custom adapters, visit Docs > Features > Adapters to learn how to 
your own custom adapter and Docs > API > Methods > ZingGrid Object > registerAdapter() to register it.

In the case of non-key based objects, the idKey can be set to indicate the id to send back to the datasource on CRUD commands.
For example, if the READ URL was https://zinggrid-named.firebaseio.com/ then the UPDATE would be https://zinggrid-named.firebaseio.com/VALUE_OF_IDKEY.

Specifies the path of the insert or CREATE response that returns an object to indicate the key value of the new record.
By default, it is set to the idKey or the raw value of the response so it would not be necessary to set this property.

Sets the path of the JSON object response to where the grid data is located.  When not specified,
it is assumed that the whole JSON object response is the grid data.  This value takes in dot notation.

Sets the path of the JSON object within the array.  When not specified,
it is assumed that the array contains the JSON object.  This value takes in dot notation.
The query parameter to specify the search value

The value to search by.  This is automatically generated when search using `<zg-search>`, but the developer
has option to specify if preferred.
Boolean value indicating that filtering should take place on the server. Requires `loadByPage` to be enabled.

This specifies a function to call to build the url for filtering on server side filter.
The function takes in a `filterObj` and is expected to return a URL query string or an object of name/pair values.
The query parameter to specify the sort field
Specifies the property to sort on.  This is automatically generated on column sort.
The query parameter that specifies sort direction
Sets the sort direction.  This is automatically generated on column sort.
Sets the status message for batch editing

The query parameter that specifies the start location.  Must specify either nextPath, nextIDPath, pageKey
or startAtKey when using loadByPage or loadByScroll.
Boolean value indicating that a value is required (instead of an index) for the next start value
The query parameter to specify limitTo amount.  Required to be used in loadByScroll or loadByPage.
Sets the page size.  Uses ZingGrid page size by default, so `should not set`.
The query paramter to specify offsetValue amount.  The default if "offset".
Sets the offset or number of records to skip

The query parameter to specify the page.  Must specify either nextPath, nextIDPath, pageKey
or startAtKey when using loadByPage or loadByScroll.
Sets the value to path of the total count of records.

Boolean indicating if we should handle the loadByPage as cursor-based.  
If set to true, no count or number of pages will be displayed.  Used in loadByPage

Boolean value enabling each page of data to be retrieved from server.  Requires setting sortBy in Firebase.  
Must specify either nextPath, nextIDPath, pageKey or startAtKey when using loadByPage.

Boolean value enabling infinite scrolling. Enabling infinite scrolling requires setting `height` on `<zing-grid>` and 
also setting the following: limitToKey, startAtKey, sortByKey, startAtValue, and sortBy. The first four are set when using Firebase adapter.
Must specify either nextPath, nextIDPath, pageKey or startAtKey when using loadByScroll.
Path to check if there is more data.

If set, looks at response packet for full link to next path.  Must specify either nextPath, nextIDPath, pageKey
or startAtKey when using loadByPage.
If set, looks at response packet for ID to next path.

If set, adds the next key to the URL to get to the next recordset.  Must specify either nextPath, nextIDPath, pageKey
or startAtKey when using loadByPage.
Path to check if there is previous data.
If set, looks at repsonse for link to previous path.
If set, looks at response packet for ID to prev path.
If set, adds the prev key to the URL to get to the previous recordset.
If loadByPage enabled, sets this to base page. The default is 1.
In the case of server side paging and type-selector-page-persist, this will indicate the field to act as an ID to persist the selection.
Specific to CSV responseType.  Specify if the first line should be the caption
Specific to CSV responseType.  Specify the separator to split the columns.  ',' is default
Specific to CSV responseType.  Specify if the first line (or second if caption defined) should be the column headers
Specific to CSV responseType.  Specify the separator to split the rows.  '\r\n' is default
Hide the table referenced in tableData
Specifies the values that should be used for the grid's header
Specifies if the grid should copy the full html value of the data rows or just the text data.
Specifies if the grid should copy the full html value of the header row or just the text data.
Specific to the firebaseSDK.  Sets the firebase collection to use.
Specific to the firebaseSDK.  Set to true if you want to use subscription mode.
Specific to the dexieCloud and supabaseJS adapter.  Sets the table to use for CRUD operations.

Sets the options for CREATE request. Options are formatted as a JSON string.
Avalable options for requests: body, requestType, exclude, headers, method, mode, responseType, src, queryString.
Not neccessary to set, the top-level values will be taken instead.

Sets the options for READ request. Options are formatted as a JSON string.
Available options for requests: body, requestType, exclude, headers, method, mode, responseType, src, queryString.
Not necessary to set, the top-level values will be taken instead.

Sets the options for UPDATE row request. 
Available options for requests: body, requestType, exclude, headers, method, mode, responseType, src, queryString.
Not necessary to set, the top-level values will be taken instead.

Sets the options for UPDATE cell request. 
Available options for requests: body, requestType, exclude, headers, method, mode, responseType, src, queryString.
Not necessary to set, the top-level values will be taken instead.

Sets the options for UPDATE request. Options can be set to either "cell" or "row" updates, the types of updates used in ZingGrid; 
options are formatted as a JSON string.
Available options for requests: body, requestType, exclude, headers, method, mode, responseType, src, queryString.
Not necessary to set, the top-level values will be taken instead.

Sets the options for DELETE request. Options are formatted as a JSON string.
Available options for requests: body, requestType, exclude, headers, method, mode, responseType, src, queryString.
Not necessary to set, the top-level values will be taken instead.
Option for request type. Sets the base URL for the request. ID is automatically inserted in the `src` for DELETE and UPDATE requests.
Option for request type. Sets the base URL for the create request.
Option for request type. Sets the base URL for the read request.
Option for request type. Sets the base URL for the update row request.
Option for request type. Sets the base URL for the update cell request.
Option for request type. Sets the base URL for the delete request.

Set to "manual" if you want to turn off traditional REST URL construction and method setting.
Set to "method" if you only want to use REST methods and not REST url construction.  
Set to "url" if you want to use REST URL construction but not REST methods.  
Set to "auto" if you want to use REST URL constuction and REST methods.
The method settings for `restmode="manual"` and `restmode="url"` is GET = GET and the all other = POST. To update
method settings, use `updateCellMethod`, `deleteMethod`, etc.
Option for request type (GET, POST, PUT, etc).  ZingGrid uses the standard request type per action, but it can overwritten with this param.
Sets the method on the create request
Sets the method on the read request
Sets the method on the update row request
Sets the method on the update cell request
Sets the method on the the delete request
Option for request type. Sets headers for request.
Option for request type. Adds an additional query string to request.
zg-param:name.notes: If possible, use existing key/value ZGParams before using this custom solution

zg-param:name.description:
Sets the body or query string of the request, which overwrites the ZingGrid generated query string. 
Can be set to a template string, string, or function name. If set to function name, the function 
takes in `rawData`, `method`, and `src` and returns an object to send as body for request.

Sets the suffix for the function name that will construct the body for the request.  
Will set the `createBody`, `readBody`, `updateRowBody`, `updateCellBody`, and `deleteBody` parameters to:
   `create` + suffix
   `read` + suffix
   `updateRow` + suffix
   `updateCell` + suffix
   `delete` + suffix

Sets the body on the create request
Can be set to a template string, string, or function name. If set to function name, the function 
takes in `rawData`, `method`, and `src` and returns an object to send as body for request.

Sets the body on the read request
Can be set to a template string, string, or function name. If set to function name, the function 
takes in `rawData`, `method`, and `src` and returns an object to send as body for request.

Sets the body on the update row request
Can be set to a template string, string, or function name. If set to function name, the function 
takes in `rawData`, `method`, and `src` and returns an object to send as body for request.

Sets the body on the update cell request
Can be set to a template string, string, or function name. If set to function name, the function 
takes in `rawData`, `method`, and `src` and returns an object to send as body for request.

Sets the body on the delete request
Can be set to a template string, string, or function name. If set to function name, the function 
takes in `rawData`, `method`, and `src` and returns an object to send as body for request.

Sets the function that handles the external data handling for creating new records
The function takes in `recordId`, `rawData`, and `options` and returns an object to send as body for request.

Sets the function that handles the external data handling for reading data
The function takes in `options` and returns an object to send as body for request.

Sets the function that handles the external data handling for updating a cell of data
The function takes in `recordId`, `rawData`, and `options` and returns an object to send as body for request.

Sets the function that handles the external data handling for updating a row of data
The function takes in `recordId`, `rawData`, and `options` and returns an object to send as body for request.

Sets the function that handles the external data handling for delete
The function takes in `recordId`, `rawData`, and `options` and returns an object to send as body for request.
Sets the error message for any server errors.  Use [[serverMessage]] token to set message from server
serverErrorPath: Sets the path to the server error message if response is JSON.
If enabled, method will not call the external REST API
If enabled, method will escape HTML wrapped in CDATA blocks on xml decoding
Sets the Content Type for the request. The default is application/json.
Sets the expected Content Type for the response. The default is application/json.
Sets the expected data type for a static data source. The default is application/json.
Any string to place at the end of a REST constructed URL. Note that this cannot be used with `restmode` is set to 'manual'.
Sets to 'cors' to specify the settings for cors request.  The external server must enable 'cors' for this to take effect.

zg-select.description: The actions of the select dropdown. The current option is pagesize.

enumValues.pagesize: Displays the page size options for the pager

zg-select.description: The comma separated string list of options to go into the Select Element
The default value of the select dropdown

zg-source.description: Indicates where to position the source

enumValues.top: place on top of the grid
enumValues.bottom: place at the bottom of the grid
enumValues.both: place on both the top and bottom of the grid

zg-text.description:
Specifies what value to generate in text field.  Current built-in options are
pager-related information.

enumValues.currpage: Displays the current page of the grid.
enumValues.pagecount: Displays the total number pages in the grid
enumValues.pagesize: Displays the number of records displayed in a grid page
enumValues.startrow: Displays the starting row index of the current grid page
enumValues.endrow: Displays the end row index of the current grid page
enumValues.rowcount: Displays the total number rows in the grid

zg-text:value.description: Displays the current page of the grid.
Displays the total amount of pages in the grid
Displays the number of records displayed in a grid page
Displays the starting record index of the current grid page
Displays the end row index of the current grid page
Displays the total amount of rows in the grid

zing-grid.description: Adds aggregate column and sets the type-aggregate-value to the specified value
Aligns the contents of the grid's text

Presence of attribute indicates the grid allows batch editing and displays the controls.
In batch edit mode, changes can be made to cells that do not have edit disabled or are not a part of the "recordkey" column.

Sets the message to display when making batch edits.  
Can use the following tokens: [[changes]], [[deleted]], [[fieldsEdited]], [[inserted]], [[modified]], [[recordsEdited]].
Can append 'Message' to any of the above for a string description.
Turns off the tooltips on all buttons in the grid
The caption for the grid
Specifies the defined `<zg-card>` of the grid.  More appropriate to use `<zg-card>` in most cases or set the property programmatically.

The type of `word-break` style for body cells. When not set, `cell-break` style is `normal` by default.
If the width of a column is set, `cell-break` is `word` by default.
To overwrite `cell-break` for cells in a specific column, set `cell-break` for that column.

enumValues.ellipsis: instead of line break, overflow is replaced with ellipsis
enumValues.normal: line break occurrs between words, if possible

zing-grid.description:
Adds a class to each `<zg-cell>` in the grid. This attribute can be applied to both
`<zing-grid>` or `<zg-column>`. If the attribute is applied to both, `<zg-column>`'s `cell-class` overwrites `<zing-grid>`'s `cell-class`.
To set a class conditionally, set `cell-class` to the name of the function, which takes in the arguments: `cellData`, `domContainer`, `cellObject`.
Turns cell editing on or off. Automatically turned on when setting `editor` or `editor-controls`.
Turns off keyboard nav cell focus if set to disabled
Sets the execution method of custom 'icon' type tooltips to either activate on hover or click of the icon

enumValues.hover: hover over cell to display tooltip

zing-grid.description:
Sets the hover delay in milliseconds before displaying the tooltip. If delay is not specified,
it is 1000ms on cell tooltips without an icon and 0ms on cell tooltips with an icon.
Specifies the icon to use for the info column types
Sets the tooltip-position for the cell

enumValues.top: Positions the tooltip on top of cell
enumValues.left: Positions the tooltip to the left of cell
enumValues.right: Positions the tooltip to the right of cell
enumValues.bottom: Positions the tooltip at the bottom of cell

zing-grid.description: Gets the name of the user's custom render function, on window, to use the function's return value as the tooltip content
Points to an external template element to be used as the template for the tooltip display
Sets the style to use for the tooltips.  Uses the `default` style by default.  Can set to `system` to match the tooltips used on icons throughout `<zing-grid>`.

enumValues.system: Features a dark background and white text.

zing-grid.description:
Adds a class to each `<zg-cell>` in targeted `<zg-column>`. To
apply a class conditionally, set the value to the name of the function to run
on each cell value. The function takes the parameters `fieldIndex`, `domContainer`,
and `colObject`, and returns a string which is the class name to apply.
Enables column dragging

Specifies the action of dragging allowed.  By default, if `column-drag` is
enabled then `column-drag-action` is set `"both"`.  This property will turn on column-drag if not already set.

enumValues.reorder: Allows columns to be dragged to reorder them
enumValues.hide: Allows columns to be dragged off of grid to hide them
enumValues.both: Allows columns to be dragged to both reorder and hide them

zing-grid.description:
Presence of attribute turns on column resizing for all columns.
This excludes internal column types (), which requires setting ZGColumn[resizable] on the column.
Sets the maximum width columns can be set to when resizing
Sets the minimum width columns can be set to when resizing
Presence of attribute displays column resizing for all columns without hover
Sets the width each of the columns
Specifies the columns of the grid.  More appropriate to use `<zg-column>` in most cases or set the property programmatically.
Presence of attribute turns on the menu to show and hide columns
Augments internal themes to a compact mode

Used to set multiple grid properties at once.  This should never be used directly.
This is meant for object instantiation.
Turns off delete confirmation if set to disable
Sets which confirmation dialogs to display on batch editing and deleting

enumValues.delete: Disables confirmation dialog when deleting rows

zing-grid.description:
Enables the default `<zing-grid>` context menu or set to the id name of a custom `<zg-menu>`.  If
set to a custom menu and `<zg-menu>` has the `replace` attribute present, then the custom menu will replace the context menu.
Otherwise the contents of the custom menu is appended to the end of context menu.
Can also set to `"browser"` to use the browser's built in context-menu
Note that the `"browser"` context-menu cannot be used together with a custom static-menu.
Sets the create editor to modal (default) or inline.

enumValues.inline: Sets the create editor to be inline

zing-grid.description: Data for the grid presented as an array or object
The data to display in each cell where the data value is null or undefined
Sets `<zg-dialog>` to display dialog and mask within the grid dimensions instead of the whole screen
The HTML standard direction to indicate direction of grid's columns and text

Turns on the grid editor.  Enables single cell editing via double click.
Sets the editor to inline (default) or modal.

enumValues.modal: Displays the grid editor as a modal

zing-grid.description: Adds columns for the editor controls.  If it is added, default is "all".

enumValues.all: Enables cell editing and adds the row editor, row remover, and row creator buttons
enumValues.creator: Adds row creator button
enumValues.editor: Enables cell editing and adds the row editor button

zing-grid.description: Comma separated list of indexes to turn off editor functionality on.  Mimes the functionality of ["editor=disabled"] on `<zg-column>`
Enables filtering for all columns.  Can be turned on/off individually via column.  Can be set to "inline" or "menu"  Default is "menu"

enumValues.menu: Enables filter menu that allows for complex filtering options
enumValues.both: Enables both the inline and menu filtering

zing-grid.description: Comma separated list of buttons to display in the specified order on the filter menu

enumValues.reset: Add button to reset filter condition(s)
enumValues.close: Add button to close filter menu
enumValues.apply: Add button to apply filter condition(s)

zing-grid.description:
The list of conditions to present as options in the filter menu condition select.  Use "break" to display the horizontal separator.  
Use "default" to use the built in default.  Can also be any custom string representing a function name.

enumValues.none: Does not apply any filter conditions
enumValues.equals: Filters for an exact match of the filter term
enumValues.notEquals: Filters out exact match of the filter term
enumValues.beginsWith: Filters for values beginning with filter term
enumValues.endsWith: Filters for values ending with filter term
enumValues.contains: Filters for values containing filter term
enumValues.notContains: Filters for values not containing filter term
enumValues.between: Filters for number values between two filter terms
enumValues.notBetween: Filters for number values not between two filter terms
enumValues.greaterThan: Filters for number values greater than filter term
enumValues.greaterEqualThan: Filters for number values greater than or equal to filter term
enumValues.lessThan: Filters for number values less than filter term
enumValues.lessEqualThan: Filters for number values less than or equal to filter term
enumValues.before: Filters for date values before filter term
enumValues.after: Filters for date values after filter term
enumValues.betweenDate: Filters for date values between filter terms
enumValues.break: Not a filter condition. Adds a horizontal separator in filter condition select menu.
enumValues.default: Filter for values containing filter term

zing-grid.description: Number of conditions to display in the filter menu on menu open
Max number of conditions to display in the filter menu
The condition to initially display on filter menu open.  Can also be any custom string representing a function name.

enumValues.none: Does not apply any filter conditions
enumValues.equals: Filters for an exact match of the filter term
enumValues.notEquals: Filters out exact match of the filter term
enumValues.beginsWith: Filters for values beginning with filter term
enumValues.endsWith: Filters for values ending with filter term
enumValues.contains: Filters for values containing filter term
enumValues.notContains: Filters for values not containing filter term
enumValues.between: Filters for number values between two filter terms
enumValues.notBetween: Filters for number values not between two filter terms
enumValues.greaterThan: Filters for number values greater than filter term
enumValues.greaterEqualThan: Filters for number values greater than or equal to filter term
enumValues.lessThan: Filters for number values less than filter term
enumValues.lessEqualThan: Filters for number values less than or equal to filter term
enumValues.before: Filters for date values before filter term
enumValues.after: Filters for date values after filter term
enumValues.betweenDate: Filters for date values between filter terms
enumValues.break: Not a filter condition. Adds a horizontal separator in filter condition select menu.
enumValues.default: Filter for values containing filter term

zing-grid.description: The areas to display in the filter menu.  Can be conditions, selectbox, or both

enumValues.conditions: Filter by selecting a condition and entering a term
enumValues.selctbox: Filter using checkboxes generated from the columnâ€™s distinct values
enumValues.both: Filter by both conditions and selectboxes

zing-grid.description:
Determines if the filter comparison should be against the raw values or the rendered.
This only applies to conditionals in the filter menu.
For iframe column type, it is restricted to raw values.
For aggregate column type, it is restricted to rendered values.
Determines if the selectbox in the filter menu should display the values as raw or rendered values.
Action that fires the filter event from the filter menu.

enumValues.button: Fires a filter event on filter button click
enumValues.change: Fires a filter event when filter conditions or selections are updated

zing-grid.description:
Adds a class to each `<zg-cell>` in the `<zg-foot>`. To
apply a class conditionally, set the value to the name of the function to run 
on each cell value. The function takes the parameters `fieldIndex`, `domContainer`,
and `colObject`, and returns a string which is the class name to apply.
Sets the number of columns to freeze to the left
Sets the number of columns to freeze to the right

Adds a class to each `<zg-row>` element. To
apply a class conditionally, set the value to the name of the function to run
on each cell value. The function takes the parameters `data`, `rowIndex` (1-based),
 `domRow`, and `rowObject`, `rowParent`, and returns a string which is the class name to apply.
Sets the number of rows to freeze to the bottom
Sets the number of rows to freeze to the top
Sets vertical, horizontal or both grid lines to the grid when in row mode
Sets the index fields to group on.

Adds a class to each `<zg-cell>` in the `<zg-head>`. To
apply a class conditionally, set the value to the name of the function to run 
on each cell value. The function takes the parameters `fieldIndex`, `domContainer`,
and `colObject`, and returns a string which is the class name to apply.

Converts camel, dash, and kebab case to properly spaced and capitalized typography.
Setting to `disabled` will turn off formatting on headers.  Set to a function name to customize formatting of headers.
Hides any header rows
Sets the execution method of custom 'icon' type tooltips to either activate on hover or click of the icon

enumValues.hover: hover over header to display tooltip

zing-grid.description: Sets the hover delay in milliseconds before displaying the header tooltip
Specifies the icon to use for the header tooltip trigger icon
Sets the tooltip icon position for the tooltip icon in the header cells

enumValues.left: Positions the icon to the left of the header
enumValues.right: Positions the icon to the right of the header

zing-grid.description: Sets the tooltip-position for the header cell

enumValues.top: Positions the tooltip at the top of the header cell
enumValues.left: Positions the tooltip to the left of the header cell
enumValues.right: Positions the tooltip to the right of the header cell
enumValues.bottom: Positions the tooltip at the bottom of the header cell

zing-grid.description: Gets the name of the user's custom render function, on window, to use the function's return value as the tooltip content
Points to an external template element to be used as the template for the tooltip display
Sets what part of the header triggers the tooltip.  If set to 'icon', an info icon is added to the header.

enumValues.text: header tooltip is triggered by header text
enumValues.icon: header tooltip is triggered by header tooltip icon

zing-grid.description: Sets the style to use for the tooltips.  Uses the `default` style by default.  Can set to `system` to match the tooltips used on icons throughout `<zing-grid>`.

enumValues.system: Features a dark background and white text.

zing-grid.description:
Sets the height of the grid.  If the height is less than the size of the content, scrolling is added
to grid body.

Allows the user to change the grid icon set to an allowed 3rd-party type (e.g., Font-Awesome).
To use a custom icon set, the icon set must first be registered.
Sets the language to use for the grid

Sets the grid layout to be either `card` or `row` and adds `<zg-layout-controls>` to the grid.
The default is based on the size of the user's screen, unless `layout` is set.

enumValues.card: Enables card layout mode for the grid
enumValues.row: Enables card layout mode for the grid

zing-grid.description:
When `layout` is set, by default `layout-controls` is enabled.
To hide, set `layout-controls` to `disabled`.  Presence of this attribute will enable
`<zg-layout-controls>` even if `layout` is not set.

Presence of attribute adds loading state to grid, which triggers `<zg-load-mask>` to show.
This attribute allows styling the height of the grid (via CSS) before the data has loaded in the grid.
Sets the text to display in the `<zg-load-mask>` on data load
Set `loadmask="disabled"` to prevent the `<zg-load-mask>` from showing on data load.

enumValues.disabled: hides loading mask when data is loading

zing-grid.description:
Indicates separator that should be used for nested headers and data paths.  By default, the '.' is used: 'fullName.first'
Setting to `disabled` will turn off parsing for nested headers and will not look at pathing for data

enumValues./: Uses the "/" as a separator when parsing for nested headers
enumValues.disabled: turns off parsing for nested headers

zing-grid.description: Sets the message that appears in the `<zg-no-data>` element when there are no records
Sets the number of records or rows to display per page. Can be set only if `pager` is set.
Sets the number of cards to display per page when in card mode. Can be set only if `pager` is set.
Sets the options for page size in `zg-option-list`. Can be set only if `pager` is set.
Sets the number of rows to display per page when in row mode. Can be set only if `pager` is set.
Adds pagination functionality and controls to the grid
Determines max number of page buttons to display.  Default is 5.

Sets pager position. Note: `pager` attribute or `<zg-pager>` must be present in
order to position pager.

enumValues.top: place pager on top of the grid
enumValues.bottom: place pager at the bottom of the grid

zing-grid.description: Determines which type of pagination to use, input or buttons
Name/Value pairs of `<zg-param>` values.  More appropriate to use `<zg-param>` in most cases.

The ID to use as the key in storing the state.  Each grid should have a unique ID or else the state data 
will be shared across grids.
The method to call when state is ready to be retrieved.  Must also set preserveStateSave and preserveStateId

Comma separated list of features to save in state preservation.  
Options are 'columnfrozen', 'columnposition', 'columnvisibility', 'columnwidth', 
'filter', 'rowgroup', 'layout', 'page', 'pagesize', 'rowfrozen', 'rowgroup', 'rowselector', 
'search', 'selector', 'sort'
NOTE:  If columnfrozen is set, then columnposition will implicitly be set as well
The method to call when state is ready to be saved.  Must also set preserveStateLoad and preserveStateId.

Sets the total record count.  Useful for `loadByPage` when the response packet
does not return total count of records.
Adds the duplicate control to the end of the row before the edit controls
Adds the record key column to the grid.  If set to a string, the string is the header text.

Adds a class to each `<zg-row>` element. To
apply a class conditionally, set the value to the name of the function to run
on each cell value. The function takes the parameters `data`, `rowIndex` (1-based),
 `domRow`, and `rowObject`, `rowParent`, `bodyRowIndex` (1 based), and returns a string which is the class name to apply.

Renderer for the row details component
To use a custom renderer, the attribute should be set to the name of the function.
The renderer function takes in the following arguments, `recordData`, `domRowDetails`, and `rowObject`
The returned value of the renderer function is set as the innerHTML of the zg-row-details component.
Points to an external template element to be used as the template for the row's details

Sets the height of each data row.  By default, the body row height is set to 'auto' where it will auto fit the content.
If you wish to apply the height to rows besides data row, specify with the `[rowHeightScope]` attribute.

If `[rowHeight]`  is set, it specifies which rows to apply row height to.
Choices are `data`, `headers, and `all`.  Can combine with comma separated list
Adds `selector` type column to the rows as the first column

Turns on the search feature and adds `<zg-search>` to the grid.
The search button appears in the caption header.

Turns on the selector feature on the grid and adds
`<zg-selector-mask>` to the grid
Indicates that the grid was completely rendered on the server and embedded in the page

Enables sorting on all columns.  It is possible to disable specific columns
via the column's object or setting `sort="disabled"` to specified columns.
Overrides default behavior for international sorting.  Turn off international sorting with `sort-intl="disabled"`.

Override the column sorting by passing in method name of sort function instead.  Sorter function
takes in two values (a, b) and returns 1, -1, or 0 indicating if `a > b`, `a < b`, or `a = b`.
Defines the source of the data in the grid. Adds the `<zg-source>` element.
Specifies the absolute or relative URL to fetch data from to populate the grid

Adds a display button that launches the contextmenu.  If
set to a custom menu and `<zg-menu>` has the `replace` attribute present, then the custom menu will replace the context-menu.
Otherwise the contents of the custom menu is appended to the end of context menu.
Note that custom static-menu cannot not be used together with a `"browser"` context-menu.
Changes the duration a status message will remain visible until it automatically closes (in milliseconds)
Prevents status messages from automatically closing after a delay
Positions the status message in one of nine positions relative to the grid

enumValues.\"top left\": Positions the status message in the top
enumValues.\"center left\": Positions the status message in the center
enumValues.\"bottom left\": Positions the status message in the bottom
enumValues.\"top center\": Positions the status message in the top
enumValues.\"center\": Positions the status message in the center of the grid
enumValues.\"bottom center\": Positions the status message in the bottom
enumValues.\"top right\": Positions the status message in the top
enumValues.\"center right\": Positions the status message in the center
enumValues.\"bottom right\": Positions the status message in the bottom
enumValues.\"bar\": Positions the status message as a bar at the bottom of the grid

zing-grid.description: Defines the regex expression for closing data binding
Defines the regex expression for starting data binding

Sets the theme of the grid.  Built-in themes are specified by keyword, but custom theme
names are also accepted by setting a URL path to your custom css theme file.  For custom themes, on load set `theme`
to the path to the custom theme file.  After, set to theme name to switch themes.
If there is a selector column, it maintains selection between pages.  This means that rows can be selected and not on the current page.
Sets the default validation error message
Sets the default validation required message
Internal attribute.  Should not be set.
Keeps current value of `viewport` and freezes the breakpoint
Removes `viewport` attribute, disabling viewport resizing

Sets custom `viewport` breakpoints (value string-object must be valid JSON).
NOTE: If you don't set `mobile`, the grid won't auto-set card or row mode.
Sets the width of the grid.  If the width is less than the size of the content, scroll is added to `<zg-body>`.

Presence of attribute adds the classes, `zebra-1` and `zebra-2`, alternating on `<zg-row>` elements.  Setting to a
list of class names will assign classes in sequential order.  For conditional zebra classes, `zebra` also accepts name of function that
returns a class name to use for zebra striping.
